website_summaries.verdict: For garage workshops, this saw is a durable, precision-cutting workhorse when working with smaller-diameter metal.
pros: Perfectly square, burr-free cuts with no “wandering” or deflection by the blade
Parts remain cool to the touch
Blade stays sharp through multiple cuts
cons: Chip collector tray doesn’t catch everything
Reports of saw blade not being properly centered, cutting into the deck
Chain hold-down should be redesigned, users feel

customer_reviews.title: ... I did was use this saw to build a nice stand for it
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I did was use this saw to build a nice stand for it. For the money this seams like a deal as long as the blades hold out. The only alternative is a real cold saw that weighs 600lbs runs on 3 phase and costs many thousands of dollars so the choice seems clear for the light fabricator and or garage builder. The cuts are accurate and precise. The only thing that is lacking is a way to set stops at 90 and 45 degree so I don't have to get out my triangle every time I change the fence...maybe I will find a work around.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Fish

customer_reviews.title: Great for mild steel be very careful with other metals
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a monster, cuts are much truer and faster than I could get with my portaband. Be warned: 1A) Avoid cutting hardened steel like bed frames in this. Just use your angle grinder. 1B) If you have to ignore 1A, then make sure the the piece is clamped down really tight and go slow. The piece can jump out and catch the blade. I've cracked a few teeth not heeding the advice of 1A and now could use a new blade. It still works pretty well. Overall, this is a really nice tool and great for doing fast miter cuts on mild steel and chromoly stock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good with issues
customer_reviews.text: This saw cuts really well. However, the 1st one started leaking oil after one month of light use. The replacement was worse; it arrived having leaked in the box. Even more problematic is that the blade is so mis-aligned, it is non-usable. In addition, the clamp is poorly designed- it does not hold tight to the table and rises up a bit when tightening. This causes the material to angle slightly and results in cuts that are not square. I do still like the saw, it is powerful and cuts clean. Makita needs to add a hold down like the dewalt has and fix the leak problem and I’d definitely give it 5stars
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool. This saw is unreal
customer_reviews.text: Next level stuff! Amazing tool. This saw is unreal. Im a wannabe fabricator always looking for a tool to make my job faster easier and better, the way this saw cuts perfectly strait 45 degree cuts makes welding them a breeze. I cut mostly 1/8 tube and theres no burrs when im done. Spend the money it will pay for its self.
customer_reviews.author: brownguy

customer_reviews.title: It works but badly constructed.
customer_reviews.text: It cuts well; now that I've actualy put it together. When it arrived I went to test it and the piece I was cutting flew accross the room along with some of the teeth on the blade. Further investigation revealed that the vise assembly had not been assembled properly. That's the sort of nonsense I'd expect from cheap chinese imports but I had hoped for better from makita. Also it trips the 30 A breaker its on more than it should. Bottom line: buy the dewalt, or if you do buy this *carefully* check it's assembled correctly before using it.
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: The best tool I own
customer_reviews.text: This saw is the best tool I own. What sets it apart is the ability to shave 1/32" off the end of a work piece with no blade deflection. That would be impossible with an old school abrasive blade. I put mine on a swivel base so I could turn the saw rather than the work for miter cuts. The only minor complaints I have are that the base isn't perfectly flat and getting the fence set to an exact 0 or 45 degrees requires a bit of effort.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest Megargel

customer_reviews.title: I love this saw
customer_reviews.text: I love this saw. I'm a hobbiest but do have a lot of nice equipment such as a CNC machine, bandsaw etc, and THIS is the tool that always gives me a big ol smile when I use it. Cuts steel and brass beautifully! Tried aluminum with the stock blade and didn't go well, but I think I need a different blade for aluminum anyways. This saw is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: T.D.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for the home welder/fabricator
customer_reviews.text: I'll never go back to an abrasive wheel again. Had this a few months now, several projects completed, cuts through 2x2x1/4" square stock like butter, did some 2x4 stock also. wish I'd bought one years ago. I was debating on going with a 14" saw but this one cuts everything I'm likely to use.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts clean and accurate
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best tool for the money, cuts through 2"stainless schedule 40 pipe like it's butter, even small cuts of big pipe pieces come off the saw cool. After cutting, there is no meltover metal to grind off, just bevel and weld. I will never use an abrasive chop saw again. This is faster, cleaner, cooler!
customer_reviews.author: Vicster

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Bought this saw in 2014 and four years later it is working as it should, I already changed the blade 4 times but if you take care of the blade and know how to use your saw. In the picture and video I uploaded you can see the saw in action of cutting 3x3 with 1/4 wall.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts great without all of the sparks and grinding grit mes ...
customer_reviews.text: Cuts great without all of the sparks and grinding grit mes of a chop saw. There will be metal chips some of which will fall into the chip pan ,but you not all do. Much cleaner than a chop saw for both the cuts and the work area. Cuts are nice and clean, pieces are cool to touch after cutting, not hot like the chop saw.
customer_reviews.author: DFL

customer_reviews.title: I love this saw
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a chop saw this metal cutting saw is amazing. I'm not sure about it being faster like they proclaim but it does make a very clean cut that is cool to the touch afterwards. I have given it a 4 star review because it doesn't seem the blade will last very long. I've only cut enough steel for 4 backflow cages and it's already showing signs of dulling.

customer_reviews.title: If you are using a chop saw just stop and ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are using a chop saw just stop and buy this. There is no going back and you will be mad that you did not go to a cold cut saw years before. I could not believe the precision and clean cut of 1" solid stock. Night and day!
customer_reviews.author: One persons view

customer_reviews.title: Fast & Handy
customer_reviews.text: The Makita is well made. These saws are very fast an accurate for fabrication cutting of steel and aluminum. I let it in Africa and since I'm too old to wear the Makita out bought a Chinese one which has a poor vise compared to the Makita. Be prepared for much cleaner cuts and area than an abrasive chop saw but also be prepared for very sharp chips, not the place to work barefoot.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: It does cut steel like butter !
customer_reviews.text: It does throw cutting all over, the cuttings tray catches about 65% of the material. The cut is warm not hot like an abrasive bladed saw. If you take your time you can make fairly accurate 45% cuts. The lock-down chain is kind of a joke on a nearly $500.00 tool, but it works, I haven't broke it yet but I expect it will at some point while your carrying it. Plenty of power and Makita quality. As a person with 38 years in the trade's I feel it was a good purchase for light duty work such as the heavy hobbyist.
customer_reviews.author: Abdiver

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw for any price. It Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm , Only had is a few weeks but so far so good cuts through metal like butter with very little effort, Would defiantly recommend for a small or medium size shop, Fits my need very well. Hardlly any sparks metal shavings are collected in the tray for easy disposal. 45 deg cuts are perfect very little metal prep after cuts if any at all.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic saw.
customer_reviews.text: I never knew that saw blades could go thru steel like this thing does. Such a time saver that it pays for itself in a week. Angles were not on the money, but seeing as how I mainly use it for 90 and 45 degree cuts, I can remember where to point the thingy. Quiet, very few sparks, and QUICK. I've been using it on 1/8 and 3/16 angle so far and its quick as a torch and infinitely more accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, True and Straight
customer_reviews.text: Better than the Dewalt one. It's a beast. Still on the same blade after cutting 2-1/2" pipe with 1/4" wall as well as 4" flat plate @ 3/4". Extremely happy with my purchase. It has a good stable weight to it- I haven't bolt it down yet, table is reliable and clamping system hasn't failed me yet. Overall I give it 6 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Hatchet Lake

customer_reviews.title: Another quality product from Makita

customer_reviews.author: Ramdslpwr

customer_reviews.title: Its a beast

And if that wasn't enough, I can use it in the garage without stinking the place out. It's noisy, if you're doing a lot of cutting ear plugs are recommended, but I can't imagine it's any noisier than anything else. So far I have been cutting 1.25" square mild steel tube, and 3x1" tube both 14ga. Very happy with this.

customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding chop saw! The saw cuts flawless. I will be soon building a drift trike out of 1 1/2" DOM .095 wall steel tubing and test cuts have already proven to be flawless, cuts are better than the balusters! This was a 5 star purchase for me!
customer_reviews.author: richard dyer

customer_reviews.title: You have to see it to believe it

customer_reviews.title: Maybe it's good machine to cut regular metals but not for stainless ...

customer_reviews.title: It works just like the video but it does throw some tiny metal ...

customer_reviews.author: HarleyBear

customer_reviews.title: This is the saw to have.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste you time on any other dry saw, this saw is the best money spent in a long time. Clean, precise and cool cuts. No need to grind before welding, total time saver.
customer_reviews.author: Trxridr

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the better metal cutting saw. We have several at work of different brands. I like this one the best. The base is cast rather than formed sheet metal.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wall

customer_reviews.title: Best saw!
customer_reviews.text: I have used many metal chop saws from abrasive to carbide. This one is by far the best! The cast aluminum base and vise is what really separates it from the others. The vice swivels nicely when locking lever is released. Much quicker than using a wrench. Only down side is that it’s only 12” but not a deal breaker as it still will cut 4x4 tube square.
customer_reviews.author: Js&ms

customer_reviews.title: cuts like butter
customer_reviews.text: Awesome chop saw. Had a missing part when I got it. Amazon sent a replacement and shipping label within 2 days. I cut all kinds of square and round tubing. This thing has a gauge for your angle miter cuts and secures the product well. It cuts like butter. Chips go in a chip tray. Usually just take my shop vac and clean the unit when done. Definite 5 star purchase.
customer_reviews.author: flyguy

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and fast
customer_reviews.text: I've been really impressed with this Makita saw. Solid feel, cuts angle iron with accurate miters and like butter. I even used it for some plywood cutting to length. Great capability for a small footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Camille

customer_reviews.title: You Get what you pay for !
customer_reviews.text: Just like the other reviews. Clean cuts. I did about 100 45 degree cuts yesterday flawlessly. Great saw and surprisingly quieter then other cold cut saws I've used. Clamp is great and built tough. And the angle adjustment couldn't be easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: T4

customer_reviews.title: Love Makita Tools!

It cuts with such precision and ease, I wish I had it years ago. You could buy a cheaper saw, but you will regret it in a very short period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Ray R

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend to anyone looking to purchase a more accurate alternative ...
customer_reviews.text: This saw is a beast. I purchased to mainly cut square tubing and it does so without question. The cuts are clean and fast. Only spark is when the blade first enters the material. Would recommend to anyone looking to purchase a more accurate alternative to a fiber blade chop saw.
customer_reviews.author: toboz78

Nice little detail is small notch that securely catches steel angle if placed down like this Λ. I cut regular mild steel angle and square tubing with it. Mine came fully assembled with blade installed.

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate to buy! Quality is top notch!
customer_reviews.text: Quality built saw that cuts perfect! 12" blades are cheaper than other 14" saws too!

customer_reviews.title: Smooth cuts
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Made 50 cuts thru 2" X 1" X 1/8" thick mild steel channel. Very pleased. Cuts smooth and easy. No apparent strain on machine. Using on 3/16 X 1 1/4" mild steel bar next. Will let you know if any problems.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice saw.
customer_reviews.text: This thing goes through steel like a hot knife through butter. Nice, clean, and accurate cuts with hardly a spark thrown. 500 times better than an abrasive chop saw. I mounted mine on a folding miter saw stand. Totally awesome setup.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Don't think twice, it's a great saw!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used an abrasive chop saw for 12 years. Bought this Makita cold saw and haven't touched my old saw since. I've cut mild steel: 4"x4" x1/4", 4" x1/4" strap, channel, angle, rod, schedule 80 pipe. It is all a breeze. Adjusting from 0-45* is as simple as flipping a lever, moving the fence, and locking the lever again. I will say that you can easily go a little past 45 as well as under 0, but the angle indicator was dead on straight from the factory. I'm kind of a Makita fan, but if this saw was made by Black and Decker it would be a great saw. A true hot knife through butter.
customer_reviews.author: Kory Rozell

customer_reviews.title: Well built metal cutter
customer_reviews.text: Not many hours on it yet but so far all the cuts I have made with this have been clean and straight. The guard concealing the blade has a strong spring action. When you're going to change the blade be sure to retract the guard all the way so that you can see and install the blade flat against the arbor.

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Had a chop saw I converted with a metal blade and a router reducer. Work good on light metal, not on thick metal. It would blow the fuse in the reducer. Decided to spend the money on the LC1230 and glad I did. I waited because the description said 240V and found out it came set up for 120v. Didn't have to run more wire.

product_meta.title: Makita LC1230 12" Metal Cutting Saw
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
This Metal Cutting Saw is fantastic for cutting light pipe, angle iron, tubing, conduit and channels. Its D-shape handle means easy gripping. Economical and long lasting carbide tipped blades cut through material fast. No more accidental starts thanks to this clever tools handy lock-off button. The guide plate on this saw adjusts 0 - 45 degrees for bevel cutting and sports a quick release vise for secure stock retention and fast repetitious cut-offs. The socket wrench is stored on the base for easy access, and a shaft lock system shaves a lot of time off wheel changes. Your purchase includes carbide tipped blade, a socket wrench, and a switch button. 

 FEATURES


 *  Cuts four times in light pipe, angle iron, tubing, conduit and channel than abrasive cut-off saws 
 *  Powerful 15 amp motor 
 *  D-shape handle for easy gripping 
 *  Long lasting carbide tipped blade for cost efficient, clean and accurate cutting; virtually burr free 
 *  Lock-off button prevents accidental starting 
 *  "Tool-less" guide plate adjusts 0 - 45° for quick and easy miter cutting 
 *  Quick release vise for secure stock retention and fast repeated cut-offs 
 *  Socket wrench stores on base for convenient blade changes 
 *  Shaft lock for easy blade changes with just one wrench 
 *  Shavings collection tray for easy waste disposal and a cleaner work environment 
 *  Large cast aluminum base for stability 
 *  Externally accessible brushes for easy maintenance 
 *  Maximum cutting depth of 4-1/2" with carbide tipped blade 

 What's in the Box


 *  Carbide tipped blade (A-90532) 
 *  Socket wrench (782210-8) 
 *  Switch button (411478-6) 

 SPECIFICATIONS


 *  Blade diameter: 12" 
 *  Arbor: 1" 
 *  Max. cutting capacities: 90° 4-1/2"; 45° 3-1/2" 
 *  No load speed: 1,300 rpm 
 *  Amps: (115V) 15.0 
 *  Overall length: 20-1/4" 
 *  Net weight: 41.9 lbs.
